pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:5.1: 95. The training rule on asking questions
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:6.2: At that time the nuns asked questions of monks who had not given leave.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:6.3: The monks complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:6.4: “How can the nuns ask questions of monks who have not given leave?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:6.5: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:6.8: How can nuns ask questions of monks who have not given leave?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:6.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:6.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:7.1: ‘If a nun asks a question of a monk who has not given leave, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:8.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:9.6: if she gets leave to ask concerning the discourses, but she asks concerning the Monastic Law or philosophy, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:9.7: If she gets leave to ask concerning the Monastic Law, but she asks concerning the discourses or philosophy, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:9.8: If she gets leave to ask concerning philosophy, but she asks concerning the discourses or the Monastic Law, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:10.1: If she has not asked for permission, and she perceives that she has not, and she asks a question, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:10.2: If she has not asked for permission, but she is unsure of it, and she asks a question, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:10.3: If she has not asked for permission, but she perceives that she has, and she asks a question, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:11.1: If she has asked for permission, but she perceives that she has not, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:11.2: If she has asked for permission, but she is unsure if she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:11.3: If she has asked for permission, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:12.2: if she asks after getting leave;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:12.3: if she gets leave, but not in regard to a specific subject, and she then asks about any subject;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:12.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:13.1: The twelfth training rule is finished.
